business.headline: Mid-segment housing: Is it the real core of India's property boom?After years of luxury-led projects, India's real estate developers are refocusing on the mid-segment — a market driven by young professionals, dual-income families, and first-time buyers. But is this segment truly the backbone of India's property boom?

The 'missing' Indian-origin CEO behind Rs 4,200 crore BlackRock loan fraudBankim Brahmbhatt, the Indian-origin CEO of a US-based telecom company, is facing a lawsuit in the US filed by HPS, the private credit investment arm of BlackRock.
Gold and silver shine again after slow start. Will they continue to rise?After a dull opening, both gold and silver managed to regain some shine during the day. Will the upward trend continue?

CBI links Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in Rs 2,796-crore Yes Bank loss caseThe CBI has accused industrialist Anil Ambani of approving favours to Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor's family, causing huge financial losses to the bank. This development highlights alleged corruption and risky investments linked to Ambani's companies.

BlackRock-backed firm accuses Indian-origin entrepreneur of $500 million fraudA US-based telecom entrepreneur of Indian origin, Bankim Brahmbhatt, has been accused of orchestrating a USD 500 million loan fraud involving BlackRock-backed lender HPS Investment Partners.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid profit booking; BEL jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 465.75 points lower at 83,938.71, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 155.75 points to 25,722.10. Selling pressure was broad-based, with most sectoral indices ending in the red.

Lenskart IPO crosses full subscription on Day 1; QIBs drive demandThe IPO opened today and closes on November 4. Lenskart has set a price band of Rs 382 to Rs 402 per share, with a lot size of 37 shares for retail bidders.

Gen Z leads India's crypto investments in Q3 2025: ReportThe 18–25 age group has officially overtaken the 26–35 bracket as the most active investors in crypto. For them, digital assets are no longer a risky experiment — they're becoming part of a serious investment plan.

From Groww to ICICI AMC: Key IPOs to watch this November 2025Bengaluru-based investing platform Groww is set to launch its IPO worth Rs 6,632.3 crore. The issue includes a fresh issue of Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 5,572.3 crore.

Buying your first house? Check the 5x annual income rule and avoid EMI trapA rising number of first-time buyers are running the affordability math more cautiously. From the 5X income rule to avoiding EMI strain, housing decisions are shifting toward sustainability rather than stretch.

HNI India rebrands as Kokuyo Workplace India, targets leadership in Asia by 2030The rebranding marks a key step in Kokuyo's plan to make India a central hub for its Asia-Pacific operations. The move comes after Kokuyo's acquisition of HNI India earlier this year.

Employees unpaid, control slipping: Bira 91's bad hangoverThe taps are dry, employees unpaid, and investors have taken charge. The question isn't how Bira 91 got here anymore. It's whether it can get out.

Gold loan vs gold overdraft: Which one truly saves you money?Gold loans and gold overdrafts both help unlock the value of your jewellery when you need cash fast. But they don't work the same way — and one could quietly cost you more than you think.

From Aadhaar to bank rules: 7 key financial changes starting November 1As November begins, a fresh set of financial rules will come into effect that could impact your daily money matters. From Aadhaar updates and bank nomination changes to new GST slabs and card fees — here's a quick look at what's changing from November 1.

Air India seeks Rs 10,000 crore lifeline from Tata, SIA after crash: ReportThe request comes at a sensitive moment for the airline, which has been trying to rebuild its reputation, modernise its ageing fleet and streamline operations since being taken over by the Tata Group in 2022.

Meta plans record $30 billion bond sale to stay ahead in AI rcaseThe move comes as Meta signals that its capital expenditure in 2026 will be "notably larger" than next year, underscoring how aggressively it is investing to stay ahead in the AI race.

Lenskart IPO opens: Check GMP, price band, and should you apply?The total issue size is about Rs 7,278 crore, of which roughly Rs 2,150 crore is a fresh issue, while the rest is an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

Gold prices shaky, silver steady. What next for precious metals?Gold is wobbling as the dollar strengthens, while silver holds firm on industrial demand cues. With central banks still buying and the Fed unpredictable, where do precious metals go next?

Sensex, Nifty open flat in volatile trade; NTPC, Cipla among top losersAt around 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up just 21.15 points at 84,425.61, while the NSE Nifty50 edged higher by 7.35 points to 25,885.20. Broader market indices also hovered marginally higher, mirroring the lack of conviction at the headline level.

entertainment.headline: Shah Rukh Khan's 60th: Skips Mannat ritual, hosts intimate fan interaction. Watch Shah Rukh Khan marked his 60th birthday with a select group of fans at a private event after cancelling his traditional Mannat appearance due to safety concerns. The celebration included candid interactions, a special viewing of the 'King' teaser, and heartfelt messages from the actor.

Naagin 7: Priyanka Chahar Choudhary to lead season, news revealed on Bigg Boss 19 Priyanka Chahar Choudhary has been confirmed as the new lead for the upcoming series of 'Naagin 7', with the announcement made on 'Bigg Boss' 19. The revelation marks a significant moment in the long-running television franchise.

Chinni Prakash on Govinda's dancing: I don't know if he was robot or human In an interview, acclaimed choreographer Chinni Prakash discusses his experiences working with Govinda, highlighting the actor's commitment, dance talent, and unique presence on set.

Shah Rukh Khan's King look sparks Brad Pitt comparison, fans clap back Shah Rukh Khan's first look for the film 'King' has ignited discussion online as viewers noticed similarities between his costume and Brad Pitt's outfit in the 'F1' film, with fans and critics sharing their opinions on social media.

Rs 20 crore HanuMan feud: Prasanth Varma breaks silence, clarifies on allegations Director Prasanth Varma has publicly addressed claims made by producer K Niranjan Reddy regarding advance payments and unfulfilled film projects. The Telugu Film 'Chamber' is currently reviewing the case, with both parties presenting their accounts.

Advised not to step out: SRK apologises to fans for cancelling Mannat fan meet Shah Rukh Khan skipped his 60th birthday fan meet in Bandra after being advised by authorities due to safety concerns. The actor apologised on X, saying he would miss seeing his fans, continuing a long-held tradition of greeting them outside Mannat every year.

Tobey Maguire's Spider-Man 4 comeback? Writer drops a major hint Comments from screenwriter Mattson Tomlin have sparked discussion among 'Spider-Man' fans regarding the potential return of Tobey Maguire in a new film, although no official confirmation has been given.

Mahesh Babu-Rajamouli's Globetrotter glimpse on OTT soon: When and where to watch Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's upcoming film featuring Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra Jonas will have its first-look teaser launch on November 15 in Hyderabad, with the event streamed live on OTT platforms.

Pankaj Tripathi's mother Hemwanti Devi dies at 89 in Bihar Hemwanti Devi, mother of actor Pankaj Tripathi, died peacefully at her home in Belsand, Gopalganj, Bihar, on October 31. The family has requested privacy as they mourn her loss.

Suhana Khan's adorable King and King's princess post for SRK's 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan celebrated his 60th birthday with heartfelt wishes from fans and celebrities. Daughter Suhana Khan's adorable post featuring "King" and "King's princess" mugs went viral.

Varun Tej-Lavanya celebrate 2nd anniversary with son Vaayuv's cute glimpse On their second wedding anniversary, actors Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi shared personal celebrations and photos featuring their baby boy, Vaayuv, giving followers a look into their family life.

Fans react to SRK's King title reveal, call him Boss of Bollywood Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' has generated significant excitement after the release of its teaser, with fans and audiences reacting enthusiastically online to the actor's latest on-screen transformation and the film's dramatic tone.

SRK turns 60: Akshay Kumar to Shilpa Shetty, celebs celebrate superstar's legacy Several celebrities poured in their love for Shah Rukh Khan on his 60th birthday today. They wrote heartfelt messages and celebrated the superstar's legacy.

Shah Bano's family files plea to halt Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's HAQ Shah Bano's family has reportedly filed a petition in Indore High Court seeking an immediate stay on the release of Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's 'HAQ'.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Kalai evicted, Vijay Sethupathi schools housemates In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', host Vijay Sethupathi schooled the contestant and discussed how the show has become unwatchable because of everyone's behaviour.

King title out: SRK's fiery and ruthless avatar on his 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan fans are rejoicing as director Siddharth Anand unveiled the title announcement video of their upcoming film 'King' on the superstar's 60th birthday. The movie is set to release in theatres in 2026.

Operation Safed Sagar teaser: Siddharth, Jimmy Shergill bring Kargil war to life The teaser of Netflix's upcoming series 'Operation Safed Sagar' was released on November 2. The show is a key mission carried out by the Indian Air Force (IAF) during the 1999 Kargil War.

BB19 Episode 70: Ashnoor opens up on body-image struggles, says she starved herself In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19's' Weekend Ka Vaar, Salman Khan addressed body-shaming comments made on Ashnoor Kaur and a contentious statement involving Sidharth Shukla. Singing siblings Neha Kakkar and Tony Kakkar also appeared on the show as special guests.

SRK's 60th bash in Alibaug: Farah Khan shares pics, KJo and Rani Mukerji attend Shah Rukh Khan marked his 60th birthday in Alibaug surrounded by friends and family, as colleagues shared glimpses from the celebration. Farah Khan and Karan Johar, among others, shared pictures from the party.

general news.headline: Historic win will inspire future champs: PM Modi on Women's World Cup triumphPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised India's maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup triumph as a "historic win" that will inspire future champions, after Harmanpreet Kaur's side defeated South Africa by 52 runs in the final.

15 dead as traveller crashes into parked truck in Rajasthan, PM condoles deathsFifteen people were killed and two others injured when a speeding tempo traveller rammed into a parked truck on the Bharat Mala Expressway in Rajasthan's Phalodi district on Sunday night.

Isro launches heaviest satellite to boost Navy's communication gridUnlike its ageing predecessor GSAT-7 "Rukmini," CMS-03 offers significantly expanded coverage and bandwidth, ensuring real-time connectivity even in remote or contested ocean zones.​

Hamas hands over bodies of three Israeli hostages amid fragile ceasefireHamas returned three hostages' bodies to Israel amid mutual ceasefire violation claims. The fragile US-brokered truce has eased fighting but sporadic violence continues, stalling progress on Gaza's stabilisation and disarmament plans.

Chef investing for daughter's education scammed. His Rs 38-lakh lesson for allJust a Facebook like by Chef Sumit Kumar got him defrauded of Rs 38 lakh in an investment impersonation scam. Such scams have resulted in 30,000 people across major cities in India losing over Rs 1,500 crore in the last 6 months. Here's why people willingly hand over their hard-earned money to scammers, and how the cash becomes untraceable.

Both Pak, Congress yet to recover from Op Sindoor: PM attacks Opposition in BiharPM Modi accused Congress' 'royal family' of losing sleep over blasts in Pakistan, saying both Pakistan and Congress' naamdars are yet to recover from Operation Sindoor.
6.3-magnitude earthquake strikes Afghanistan's Hindu Kush regionA 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Hindu Kush region on Monday, with the epicentre near Khulm, the USGS reported.

Advised not to step out: SRK apologises to fans for cancelling Mannat fan meetShah Rukh Khan skipped his 60th birthday fan meet in Bandra after being advised by authorities due to safety concerns. The actor apologised on X, saying he would miss seeing his fans, continuing a long-held tradition of greeting them outside Mannat every year.

Wide awake at 11 pm? Blame the Second Wind EffectIf you are feeling a sudden burst of energy after a long day and right before going to bed, it does not mean you should "make the most of it." Experts call it the second wind phenomenon and here's what you should know about it.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Nothing we could do: Andhra temple owner blames devotees for stampede that killed 9At least nine people, eight women and one child, lost their lives in the stampede that broke out at Srikakulam's Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple on Saturday morning.

Canada's Carney highlights progress in India ties amid push to cut US dependenceCanadian PM Mark Carney highlighted progress in rebuilding ties with India, stressing efforts to diversify trade beyond the US and strengthen partnerships across the Indo-Pacific for economic growth.

Blinkit customer recalls delivery agent arriving in tears over deduction after complaintIn a now-viral post on Reddit, a user recalled how a Blinkit delivery agent arrived at their door in tears after a missing-item complaint led to a deduction from his earnings.

48 Tamil Nadu parties, led by MK Stalin, to challenge SIR in Supreme CourtFollowing an all-party meeting, Stalin wrote on X that the real intention behind the SIR is to take away the democratic rights of the people, and hence, it is the responsibility of all political parties to stand up against the process.

Shah Bano's family files plea to halt Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's HAQShah Bano's family has reportedly filed a petition in Indore High Court seeking an immediate stay on the release of Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's 'HAQ'.

India level T20I series as Arshdeep, Sundar shine in 5-wicket win over AustraliaAUS vs IND, 3rd T20I: Arshdeep Singh's fiery comeback and Washington Sundar's late cameo powered India to a five-wicket win over Australia in Hobart, levelling the T20I series 1-1.

King title out: SRK's fiery and ruthless avatar on his 60th birthdayShah Rukh Khan fans are rejoicing as director Siddharth Anand unveiled the title announcement video of their upcoming film 'King' on the superstar's 60th birthday. The movie is set to release in theatres in 2026.

Girl, 9, jumps to death at Jaipur school; cops say bloodstains at scene wipedA 9-year-old girl died after allegedly jumping from the fourth floor of Jaipur's Neerja Modi School. Her parents and a parents' association have accused the school of harassment and evidence tampering.

India needs to grow thicker skin: Shashi Tharoor slams deporting Hindi scholarShashi Tharoor criticised India for deporting Hindi scholar Francesca Orsini, warning that such actions harm the nation's global image and urging greater openness to foreign academics.

PM does yoga for votes, Adani and Ambani dance after polls: Rahul Gandhi's digAddressing a rally in Bihar's Begusarai, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi claimed PM Narendra Modi does not listen to the people and "vanishes" after elections.

India's teachers are burning out, and students are paying the priceTeachers carry emotional and academic load round the clock, leading to burnout that affects classrooms and student wellbeing. Experts say student mental health cannot improve without supporting teachers and involving parents. India needs better support systems, training, and recognition to protect educators.
India did a big test in space after LVM3 launch, Isro chief revealsThis breakthrough shows Isro's advancing technological prowess, particularly in enhancing space mission precision and efficiency.

Ankur Warikoo's 7-38-55 formula to crack job interviews is going viralIn a viral post, Ankur Warikoo explained why most candidates fail interviews despite good answers. His viral post highlighted the 7-38-55 rule, showing that tone and body language matter more than words.

Portfolios of murder, kidnapping will be distributed if RJD wins: Amit ShahTaking a sharp jibe at Lalu Prasad Yadav's party and family, the Union Home Minister said that Jungle Raj will return to the state if the Rashtriya Janata Dal-led Mahagathbandhan comes back to power.

sports.headline: Watch: Harmanpreet Kaur lifts India's first-ever Women's World Cup trophy Tears, joy, and pure pride at DY Patil Stadium — India's women's cricket team etched their names in history, lifting their maiden ICC Women's World Cup trophy amid thunderous cheers and emotional celebrations.

After doing a Kapil Dev for India, Harmanpreet Kaur vows to make winning a habit India clinched their first Women's World Cup title after 20 years with a thrilling win over South Africa. Harmanpreet Kaur's decisive catch and Shafali Verma's all-round performance marked a historic moment for Indian women's cricket.

Watch: Jhulan Goswami in tears as she lifts World Cup alongside Mithali Raj Indian legend Jhulan Goswami was left in tears as he finally got the chance to hold the Women's World Cup title as India won the title on Sunday, November 2. India defeated South Africa by 52 runs to win the final.

Watch: Radha Yadav and Jemimah console Marizanne Kapp after South Africa's heartbreak Jemimah Rodrigues and Radha Yadav consoled a heartbroken Marizanne Kapp after South Africa's loss in the Women's World Cup final on  Sunday in Navi Mumbai — a touching moment between Delhi Capitals teammates.

You brought it home: Cricketing world hails India's historic Women's World Cup title Cricket legends and fans unite to celebrate India's historic Women's World Cup triumph. From Tendulkar to Kohli, the cricketing world hails Harmanpreet Kaur's team for inspiring a new generation with their grit and glory.

The girls deserve it every bit, made every Indian proud: Amol Muzumdar Amol Muzumdar was full of pride after India's historic Women's World Cup triumph, calling it a watershed moment for Indian cricket. Praising his team's hard work, belief, and resilience, he said the victory will inspire generations to come.

On wheelchair, Pratika Rawal celebrates India's World Cup win with tricolour Women's World Cup, IND vs SA: Pratika Rawal wasn't a part of the final against South Africa, but she celebrated India's win on Sunday in Navi Mumbai. Pratika scored 308 runs from seven matches before getting ruled out of the tournament.

Indeed God-sent: Shafali Verma writes her redemption tale in World Cup final Women's World Cup final: From being dropped and doubted to dazzling on the grandest stage, Shafali Verma's fearless 87 and inspired bowling spell turned heartbreak into history — a redemption tale that will echo through Indian cricket for generations. God-sent, indeed.

No sleep for 45 days, no problem: Mandhana overcomes heartbreaks with World Cup win Smriti Mandhana opened up on India's emotional journey to their maiden Women's World Cup 2025 title, describing it as a triumph born out of heartbreaks and sleepless nights. On Sunday, India beat South Africa by 52 runs in the final.

India's Women in Blue Conquer the World! PM Modi Hails 'Spectacular' Historic World Cup Win This special report focuses on the jubilant reactions following the Indian women's cricket team's historic, first-ever World Cup victory, led by a congratulatory message from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. 'A spectacular win by the Indian team in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 Finals. Their performance in the final was marked by great skill and confidence,' the Prime Minister stated in a post on X. The nation celebrated as captain Harmanpreet Kaur's team defeated South Africa by 52 runs in a thrilling final in Navi Mumbai to clinch the coveted ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 trophy. This landmark achievement for the 'Women in Blue' is being hailed as a golden moment for Indian cricket, which will inspire a new generation of athletes across the country.

Virat Kohli celebrates Women's World Cup triumph: Couldn't be more proud as Indian Virat Kohli joined in on the celebrations as India defeated South Africa to win their maiden Women's World Cup title on Sunday, November 2. India won the match by 52 runs to claim the trophy.

On wheelchair, Pratika Rawal celebrates India's World Cup win with tricolour Women's World Cup, IND vs SA: Pratika Rawal wasn't a part of the final against South Africa, but she celebrated India's win on Sunday in Navi Mumbai. Pratika scored 308 runs from seven matches before getting ruled out of the tournament.

God-sent, indeed.

On Sunday, India beat South Africa by 52 runs in the final.

India's Women in Blue Conquer the World! PM Modi Hails 'Spectacular' Historic World Cup Win This special report focuses on the jubilant reactions following the Indian women's cricket team's historic, first-ever World Cup victory, led by a congratulatory message from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. 'A spectacular win by the Indian team in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 Finals. Their performance in the final was marked by great skill and confidence,' the Prime Minister stated in a post on X. The nation celebrated as captain Harmanpreet Kaur's team defeated South Africa by 52 runs in a thrilling final in Navi Mumbai to clinch the coveted ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 trophy. This landmark achievement for the 'Women in Blue' is being hailed as a golden moment for Indian cricket, which will inspire a new generation of athletes across the country.

Virat Kohli celebrates Women's World Cup triumph: Couldn't be more proud as Indian Virat Kohli joined in on the celebrations as India defeated South Africa to win their maiden Women's World Cup title on Sunday, November 2. India won the match by 52 runs to claim the trophy.

Watch: Entire nation rejoices as India lift maiden Women's World Cup titleIndia erupted in joy as the women's cricket team lifted their maiden World Cup title, defeating South Africa in a historic finale. From streets to stadiums, celebrations swept the nation as fans, players and legends hailed the team's unforgettable triumph.

Watch: Rohit Sharma gets emotional as India crowned Women's World ChampionsRohit Sharma got emotional as the Indian team defeated South Africa to win the Women's World Cup 2025 in Navi Mumbai. India won their maiden title by 52 runs infront of a rampant home crowd.

India lift historic Women's World Cup crown, ending two decades of heartbreakIndia won their maiden Women's World Cup title after beating South Africa by 52 runs on Sunday in front of a packed house at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. Shafali Verma and Deepti Sharma starred for them as India ended their wait for an ICC title.

Cricket & Faith: Fans Hold Havan for India's World Cup Final GloryThis special report focuses on a 'Havan' and prayer ceremony organised at a Gaushala in Chandigarh's Sector 45 for the Indian women's cricket team ahead of their World Cup final against South Africa. According to organiser Vinod ji, 'Our country was earlier called a country of illiterates... but today our daughters are making a name for themselves in every field.' The event, coinciding with the festival of Tulsi Vivah, saw devotees praying for the team's victory. The report highlights the deep connection between faith and sports in India, and frames the prayer as part of a broader celebration of women's empowerment, referencing their achievements in civil services, judiciary, and politics. The organisers have also planned to distribute sweets and celebrate on a large scale upon the team's victory.

Defying Terror: Global Athletes Join Kashmir Marathon After Pahalgam AttackThis special report focuses on the second edition of the Kashmir Marathon, organised by the Jammu and Kashmir tourism department in Srinagar, which saw participation from hundreds of international and local athletes. A participant captured the spirit of the event, stating, 'I just enjoy with my friends here... because of you know people came from across here. That's why I joined to this.' The marathon, featuring 42 km and 21 km categories, is a significant initiative to boost tourism and project a message of peace and normalcy. It gains particular importance as it is one of the biggest events in the valley held after a deadly terror attack in Pahalgam in April 2025, which claimed the lives of 26 civilians. The event aims to showcase Kashmir's resilience and strengthen its reputation as a premier destination for adventure tourism.

Watch: Golden arm Shafali Verma delivers twice as Harmanpreet's gamble pays offShafali Verma's golden arm turned the tide in India's favour as she dismissed Marizanne Kapp in the Women's World Cup final. Harmanpreet Kaur's bold gamble paid off in style, with India seizing control amid wild celebrations in Navi Mumbai.

Nair continues to haunt Kerala with double hundred, continues India recall pushKarun Nair continued to punish Kerala with a brilliant double hundred as he made a push for a return to the Indian Test team. Nair and Ravichandran Smaran helped Karnataka gain advantage in the Ranji Trophy clash.

South Africa's Laura Wolvaardt creates history, surpasses Alyssa Healy's recordLaura Wolvaardt etched her name in history with 512 runs and counting, surpassing Alyssa Healy's record for the most runs in a single Women's ODI World Cup edition. The South African skipper's stellar form continues as she leads the chase against India in the 2025 final.

A participant captured the spirit of the event, stating, 'I just enjoy with my friends here... because of you know people came from across here. That's why I joined to this.' The marathon, featuring 42 km and 21 km categories, is a significant initiative to boost tourism and project a message of peace and normalcy. The event aims to showcase Kashmir's resilience and strengthen its reputation as a premier destination for adventure tourism.

Harmanpreet Kaur's bold gamble paid off in style, with India seizing control amid wild celebrations in Navi Mumbai.

South Africa's Laura Wolvaardt creates history, surpasses Alyssa Healy's recordLaura Wolvaardt etched her name in history with 512 runs and counting, surpassing Alyssa Healy's record for the most runs in a single Women's ODI World Cup edition. The South African skipper's stellar form continues as she leads the chase against India in the 2025 final.

3rd T20I: Afghanistan complete sensational 3-0 series sweep over ZimbabweAfghanistan delivered a dominant all-round display to defeat Zimbabwe by nine runs in the third and final T20I at Harare Sports Club on Sunday (November 2), sealing a comprehensive 3-0 series sweep.

Women's World Cup Final: What's the record for the highest successful chase?South Africa will need to pull off a record-breaking chase if they are to defeat India in the Women's World Cup 2025 final in Navi Mumbai on Sunday. With a target of 299, they face the daunting task of surpassing the highest successful run chase ever achieved in a Women's World Cup final.

Gambhir-level decision: Team India slammed for sending Amanjot ahead of Richa GhoshFans were left stunned after India sent Amanjot Kaur ahead of Richa Ghosh in the Women's World Cup final against South Africa. Despite Richa's fiery form, the call baffled many, sparking strong reactions online as India set a 299-run target.

Kuldeep Yadav released from India T20I squad, to feature in South Africa A seriesKuldeep Yadav has been released from India's T20I squad against Australia on Sunday, November 2. Kuldeep will join the India A squad for the second four-day match against South Africa A.

I don't chase results, focused on doing what's required of me: Washington SundarWashington Sundar showcased his growing T20 prowess as India chased down 187 to beat Australia by five wickets at the Ninja Oval. Displaying calm and power, he hit crucial sixes and later said he focuses on enjoying the game rather than chasing results or pressure.

Rohit Sharma at Navi Mumbai stadium with wife Ritika to cheer for IndiaWomen's World Cup final: Rohit Sharma was present at DY Patil Stadium to support India women's cricket team.  Rohit was seen watching the final between India and South Africa while seated alongside ICC chairman Jay Shah on Sunday, November 2.

Harmanpreet Kaur scripts record for most runs in Women's ODI World Cup knockoutsHarmanpreet Kaur broke the record for the most runs scored in Women's ODI World Cup knockouts during the 2025 edition final between India and South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai on Sunday.

Focused on execution: Arshdeep reflects on POTM show vs Australia in HobartAustralia vs India: After winning the Player of the Match award in his T20I comeback, Arshdeep Singh said he has been focusing on clarity and consistency rather than chasing results.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
